Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: deannaNY
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this place in the night and the taxi driver didn't know where the hotel was, when we found the hotel our room was at an upper floor but the only way to reach the room, with our heavy and big suitcases, were the stairs!! In the morning the owner a highly tanned woman annoyed us trying to impose what to do during our stay and where to eat... we think that they give her some money since she was very insistent... while she was screaming on the phone with someone...she told us about her life and her daughter, we had to stop her to bother us telling her we didn't understand what she was trying to say...Another woman at the computer prevented us to check our mail at the computer since wi fi connection was off!! The rooms are small and price excessive...The only positive thing is the location...few minutes from Spanish Steps. We would not at all suggest this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very helpful, friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: mechandler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Fontanella Borghese hotel several times now and it is always wonderful. The location couldn't be better for shopping and is surrounded by several great little restaurants. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Breakfast is included with local pastries, fresh fruits, cereal and coffee/tea. The have Wi-Fi in the lobby, as well as a computer for guests to use. Most important, the staff at this hotel are all friendly and extremely helpful. I can highly recommend the Hotel Fontanella Borghese!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, perfect location, ultra friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Inaie
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the hotel and it's staff. Cynthia, the owner makes sure everyone is well taken care of, but to be honest, it would not be necessarym, as her staff are so well trained and friendly, they just make you feel at home. The location could not be better!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling - complete waste of money and ruins your holiday exoerience”
Reviews.Author: MazzAustralia
Reviews.Content: Wanted unique, menorable and comfortable experience for stay in rom and saw very positive reviews and looked lovely in pictures. Got rude ( eg being told if did not like the fact that there was only one soap in room between 2 people - then make a complaint) unhelpful (eg don't know but there's the laptop am sure you can find it if you search), room very noisy from street sounds, small and to be honest uncomfortable for 2 travellers not a couple. Really nothing special at all and definitely not worth the price that was charged. (4 star prices mainly due to location which was ok but not special, and provide 1 to 2 star facilities and service) If you like cheap, broken, bad quality reproduction fixtures and fittings, blackened walls and am amazingly dangerous staircase ( 2 steps near top need fixithistle this is the place for you. so this all added up to a uncomfortable experience and complete waste of money, how this place got those positive reviews amazes me!! A mid market tourist rip off

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, wonderful staff, good prices”
Reviews.Author: novembre1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Room small and cleaned. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Tv set nice and good selection of channels on offer. Very good breakfast, included in very reasonable rates. Free internet (only in the main hotel hall). Bottles of water at the hotel are not a rip off. It feels like staying with friends. You enter into a nice Roman old house and then you go up to the second floor ( tiny elevator or 4 flights of stairs). Staff are very nice and very helpful. When you go out, you can feel the heartbeat of Rome. If you turn right you have, after 80 metres, "Ciampini", which I consider among the top bars for snacks and cappuccino. Via condotti e via Frattina are 200 metres away. For the price you pay, you can hardly get a better deal. The only drawback is the limited number of rooms. Only for happy few.

Reviews.Title: “Four visits in 10 years”
Reviews.Author: Sempre39
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fontanella Borghese for the fourth time in about ten years. Everything that drew us to this hotel in the first place remains the same: great location, comfortable room, helpful staff, friendly owner, a nice breakfast to start the day, all at a reasonable rate. Our room on this visit was the smallest yet and seemed a little bare of wall decoration, but the bed and room temperature were very comfortable and we weren't bothered by exterior noise even though our window overlooked Vicolo della Torretta. Only one minor housekeeping issue: the desk lightbulb was out and wasn't replaced during our three-night stay, although I mentioned it to the reception staff. Restaurant recommendations were excellent, especially Il Bacaro specifically suggested by the owner, Cinzia.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: mary m
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at Hotel Fontanella Borghese and hopefully it will not be our last because the treatment we received from the owner and staff truly made our trip all that much more amazing. The hotel is clean, homy and comfortable. It's walking distance to just about all major tourist spots. Less than a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and shopping. About a 20 minute walk to the Colosseum. The owner Cynthia is an amazing hostess. She is very friendly and extremely helpful. We also loved Khalid and Manuela who went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. I would highly recommend Hotel Fontanella Borghese. It's a five star in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best place for a turist in Rome”
Reviews.Author: luka___ristic
Reviews.Content: Absolutly helpful, 100% fluent in english receptionists, willing to draw you on map which you get there any place you wanna go, with bus stops and metro. Very comfortable rooms, great clean bathrooms, with AC working very pleasantly all the time. Location is just unreplaceable. Absolutely everywhere a turist would wish to go, you can go on foot. Walking distance from Piazza Spaanga, Piazza Navona, Piazza Venezia... Except location the best thing is probably the breakfast, with more then 3 versions of croasans etc., with ability to order by room service, free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: robertmaster123
Reviews.Content: This was the third time that we stayed at the Fontanella Borghese. The hotel has a great central location and is within walking distance of most tourist sites. Reasonably priced considering the location. However the downside is that there is a small slow elevator and the rooms arer small. The rooms are old and not luxiurious but considering the price they are a good value.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: islandervne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel upon arriving in Rome. The entry way into the hotel looked nicer than the interior of the rooms. The hotel might also be a little tricky to find since it is inside a gated courtyard (sometimes it's open) on the second floor. There is a miniature elevator for you to send your luggage up in but won't fit much beyond that. The rooms were a little bare and tired looking. We were a little disappointing by the quality and size of the room for the price. The location was the best thing about this hotel, as it was very conveniently located near the spanish steps and shopping area. The service of the front desk was generally pretty unfriendly. The young lady that was there when the second half of our group arrived was extremely rude and gave us a lot of attitude when we forgot to leave our passport at the front desk for about an hour. The man who was at the reception later in the evening was also very rude. We had a couple questions about getting around the city and he answered rather begrudgingly with a lot of sighing and silent staring. The woman who prepared fresh coffee and breakfast in the morning was very nice, as was the owner, whom we met on the last day while checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific experience...future guests beware”
Reviews.Author: JuliePogue
Reviews.Content: This hotel was filthy and the ac did not work. We checked-in, went to the room and immediately checked out. The gentleman at the front desk would not refund our money and we had to pay for another hotel. He actually was extremely rude and made my daughter and me very uncomfortable. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: robS101
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed the location of this little boutique hotel in the heart of Rome. It lacks a restaurant, and some of the other amenities you might expect in a bigger property, but makes up for it with a friendly staff, great location, and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable breakfast embarrasses a desirable hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMFSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fontanella Borghese is well-located, has excellent service, and has clean, small rooms -- a positive formula for success in central Rome. However, among 20 two and three star hotels in Italy, we found this by far the most minimal breakfast -- an embarrassment to Italian hospitality and certainly to these owners. Packaged cheese, packaged lunch meat, absence of hot eggs and bacon and fresh fruit salad (these latter standard fare in all other Italian hotels) reflect badly enough on the Fontella Borghese that we would never recommend it to family or friends. We travel 4 months a year and rarely have occasion to write a review, and certainly a negative one. We regret this, but perhaps the Fontanella Borghese will get the message and repair this marginal practice.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located and Attentive to their guests”
Reviews.Author: bnoel
Reviews.Content: Located halfway between the Spanish Steps and Vatican City, Borghese Hotel strives to make every guest's stay the most enjoyable. A nice continental breakfast starts your day off on a good note, and the myriad of good restaurants within 100 yeards makes a great ending to each day. Hotel sits back off of street, and entrance is thru a courtyard and up to the second floor in a very small elevator. Staff (and the owner) handle every request from recommendations for dinner to directions to having taxis ready when you want to leave in a most efficient manner. My wife and I will definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jonbetsy
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful choice for our stay in Rome. The hotel is centrally located, minutes from the Pantheon and the Spanish Steps. Its not a fancy place: the hotel is on the third floor, but the rooms are good sized, clean, comfortable beds, and relatively quiet given the central location. The owner and staff were very helpful and friendly. We would make this our base in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: edwardcali
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location and value. Between the Spanish Steps and Piazza Narvona. You are also close to the Vatican and tons of great restaurants. The rooms are spacious, with nice bathrooms (both by European standards). While the furnishings quality, they are dated. The breakfast is standard European, in other words good but not much food. Where this hotel really stands out is service. The staff is friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The housekeeping is also quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hula22
Reviews.Content: Due to reviews online we tried this Hotel Fontanella Borghese. Its a quaint hotel with an old lift to the 2nd flr. About 20 steps up to our room, but that was fine. Room overlooked courtyard & oh so quiet. Secure gate closed at night. Wireless 5 euros per day & TV shows in Italian. Wow, what a great location; we walked to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, shopping, Navona square, Pantheon even though I have difficulty walking far. Hotel arranged Appian Way Tours to take us to Ostia Antica which was wonderful & affordable. Room was clean; only negative was drain clog lst 2 nights. Hotel staff very helpful & loved the coffee and breakfast which consisted of boiled eggs, pastries, juices, water, fruits. Quite expensive room rate though. Thanks to Tripadvisor for the heads' up!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal and convenient for a nice place to stay while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nktravel
Reviews.Content: Italian charm, located away from major tourism yet still 5-10 min. walk away from the Piazza di Spanga. Not much for views but you could hear accordians playing nightly outside the shuttered windows. "Khaled" a staff member at the front desk was especially helpful and kind with making our stay at Fontanella a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rferr
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said the Fontanella Borghese is in a great location but is showing signs of age. Bathroom was tired as was the furniture and bed covering. Owner was friendly if not a bit "pushy" and the breakfast was adequate. Would not rate this as highly as others have rated it and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Met needs very well”
Reviews.Author: Family4Tripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently with 8 and 11 year old children and extended family. Rooms were clean (but small), location was terrific (a few blocks from Spanish Steps) and air conditioning worked great (lifesaver!). Front desk was fine. Hotel is very quiet. Breakfast was basic, good and sufficient. Must pay for wifi. Lobby sitting area worked great to hang out together - no one else used it. Definitely would recommend. Only tips: if important that rooms are side by side, be sure to clarify. Ours were separated so adults had to share rooms with each child. Also, both rooms had (large) queen beds so be sure to specify if you want twins. Looked in on a family quad - nice and spacious and would be sufficient if one bathroom is okay and if no one needs to nap. Avoid restaurants in adjacent piazza - was recommended by desk but was overpriced, dirty and not good. Lots of choices nearby if you do your homework. Great gelato on same piazza, however!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: AZgrandmaPhoenix
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews have said it is a wonderful place to stay. The Karen Brown Travel Guide was right once again! Great value for the terrific location. As a grandmother traveling with my daughter and two teen grand daughters, I was concerned about a safe location. It is across from a Spanish Embassy annex and is guarded day and night. We walked everywhere. No need for buses or taxis. Kalid and other staff members went above and beyond to make sure we had a wonderful visit. Quiet location. Only the sea gulls woke us up! Beds were great. Bathrooms have small showers, but no big deal. Happy we got two rooms so the girls had their own bathroom and internet. It is only 22 rooms so much like a Bed and Breakfast. Definitely a find!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent service, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: bassabill
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, spotless hotel on two floors of a palazzo accessible by elevator from courtyard. Large room with kingsize bed, nice bathroom with quality toiletries and large, soft towels. Nice closet with extra pillows and blankets. Basic breakfast with eggs, cold cereals, pastry and excellent coffee including cappuccino on request. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is fabulous. Spanish embassy directly across the street. Step out of the hotel and look to the right and you see the Spanish Steps. Walk a few blocks south and you are at Piazza Navone. Many major sites within easy walking distance or accessible by bus. Multitude of cafes. Excellent grocery/deli across the street. Fashionable Via dei Condotti is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, you can walk to everywhere”
Reviews.Author: aliasJupiter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 nights in February. The owner and staff are all very nice and helpful. Rooms are low key but have a good size and very good price value. They were also quiet, which for Rome is rare. No unneeded extras in the hotel, which was fine for us. The breakfast was good and there's plenty of excellent restaurants within walking distance. Just ask Khaled, he'll even reserve for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tintop5
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with beautiful rooms. The best possible location, as is centrally located to all of the major sights. The area is expensive so ask hotel clerks about less expensive options. Breakfast was a varied mix of pastries, cereals, etc. Staff was helpful. Beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Owner, Street Noise, Plumbing Non-functional”
Reviews.Author: Nashville_TNJill
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading Frommers Rome and Tripadvisor reviews, all of which have been positive. We, unfortunately, didn't have the experience at Fontanella Borghese that others have had. Firstly, when we arrived, we met the owner, who was quite rude. We asked for a wake-up call after a nap, which we didn't receive. She was then quite disdainful when we didn't know how to use the safe key. When my husband inadvertently took the room key, she was quite angry and aggressive. Minimal help was offered when we asked for directions and a way to change money. Unfortunately, this experience soured our stay at the hotel. Additionally, the plumbing for the shower didn't work well. You could only take a five minute shower before the water overflowed. Many of the lights didn't work, as well. Finally, the street noise was really loud at night. To be fair, I must list the positives about the hotel. It was very clean and the price was reasonable. However, overall, we were quite displeased with this hotel and moved to the Hotel Mozart for our remaining two days in Rome. We loved the Hotel Mozart!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: BoiseMom
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, exceptional staff, ideal location. Our family managed to squeeze into one beautifully decorated room and thoroughly enjoyed our first visit to Rome due in large part to this hotel, its location, and the helpful staff. Excellent breakfast was included in our rate--the best breakfast we had during our month-long travels through Italy and France. Once we got to the hotel from the airport, we were able to walk everywhere and rarely used public transportation. Also located within easy walking distance of several restaurants. Most of the staff spoke fluent English and were helpful as we planned each day's outing. The owner also made arrangements for us in a beautiful B and B in Florence the day we left Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Fantastic Front Desk too!”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on some reviews in Fodors etc and some comments on Tripadvisor. We booked it for the location which is great -- Spanish steps in sight, Trevi and many other attractions in easy walking distance etc. But what made it particularly good for us was the friendly and informative staff. One other reviewer mentioned honesty as well, which is what we found ++ one of our party lost an earring somewhere during the day. It was found there and returned without fuss. When we needed to print something out of hours, the person looking after the night desk gave us his personal email address so he could print from there, to save us waiting for the reception staff to log on the next morning for the main email address. They stored our bags for a couple of days when we went to Venice then returned. And we got some excellent restaurant suggestions from them which were perfect for what we were looking for. (Incidentally you might want to stay away from the nearby Lupus restaurant which we picked ourselves -- the waiter got three orders from five people wrong, including bringing one person's main as another's entree, while insisting he was right -- and local seemed to be getting more and better dishes.) Anyway, back to the hotel. The breakfast was good too and included. It is Rome though and the rooms are comfortable but not particularly big, and there is quite a bit of traffic noise from time to time. However, that is really what Rome accommodation is I think if you are in a good spot, at least unless you pay a smal fortune. So all in all, we thoroughly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great find for a modest hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: vecchio05
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location is all you need to know. You can walk almost anywhere from this little gem, and it is tucked away on a quiet little street. The rooms are very modest, but the breakfast was suitable, and for the price, is an excellent bet when in Rome. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable honesty”
Reviews.Author: RomanConnie
Reviews.Content: One of the best values in Rome. So centrally located that even us 75 year olds could walk everywhere. The personal service here, is in a word, superb. The staff is exceptionally willing and able to help make your trip pleasant. They remain smiling thru the most mundane questions. (“Rude Staff” - pay no attention to that comment - couldn‘t disagree with it more.) Here is something else you won’t see often. When we got home we received an email from the hotel informing us we had overpaid our bill by 50 Euros. We had a 7:00 am flight to catch and in our haste in the wee hours, we apparently lost track of the cash vs. VISA as we dumped all our remaining Euros on them. We had NO idea, but they caught it and mailed the cash to us. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “'Wonderful'”
Reviews.Author: oldenglander
Reviews.Content: My thanks to our friends who recommended this hotel to us. I can understand why they always (18 years and counting!) use this hotel when in Rome. Staff, location, quality, consideration, knowledge, helpfulness, etc all 100%. They all made our stay in Rome so good.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless booking, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Infantraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at this hotel with two extremely well-travelled cousins. Most impressive was the experience of booking directly with the hotel (and not through the internet),encouraged by reviews in Fodor's and The New York Times. Service was fast, sensitive and efficient. When we arrived almost 2 months after our booking, everything was just as expected. The rooms are not enormous, but clean and quiet. We could walk everywhere,from the Spanish Steps to the Via Condotti (and the stunning 'Fendi Palace') to the Pantheon, stumbling across amazing piazzas along the way. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a find!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityWanderer
Reviews.Content: Location was great , breakfast was fine + available late, as well as early, + staff was helpful + made tour, museum + restaurant reservations with good cheer. Only drawback was that rooms are a bit cozy, to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RealtOr30
Reviews.Content: You enter through a courtyard--the hotel is charming and rooms are comfortable. Fantastic location. The street becomes the high end shopping street --Via Condotti and leads to the Spanish Steps. Staff was friendly and helpful. The owner even came to the breakfast room and talked to everyone. The buffet breakfast was good, even had freshly baked quiche. A pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahheleng
Reviews.Content: quiet area , friendly staff , very nice breakfast each morning , great location , very clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMA07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our teenage son for one night in July. Our trip to Rome was divided between a 4-night stretch, then off to Florence, with one night in Rome again at the end. We had a hard time deciding whether to spend four nights at the Hotel Campo de Fiori and one night here or four nights here and one there. We ended up spending one here and were glad we didn't stay longer. (The Campo de Fiori is fantastic). The staff wasn't particularly helpful and didn't seem to know a single place to eat in the neighborhood that wasn't expensive. (It was interesting, because they were very good on reservations in advance but not good when we got there). The breakfast was good. We had a decent night there, but it can't compete with the Campo de Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: jgirll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a two week trip in Italy and this was easily the worst hotel we stayed at. The room was decent (the bathroom didn't even have the normal shampoo that hotels provide, but rather a dispenser that they would refill. weird). The worst part about this hotel was how rude and unhelpful the staff was. We were trying to figure out train times or transportation to other cities and the desk clerk straight out said he would not help us! It was so strange considering all our other hotels had gladly assisted us. I would definitely not recommend this hotel. You can get much better accommodations and service for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jbcarls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fontanella Borghese based upon Frommers and Trip Advisor research. It is a small quiet hotel with a great staff and is removed from the main street by a courtyard that you walk through before getting to the hotel that is reached by either a small lift or 2 flights of stairs. The front desk was helpful the entire time we were there with information on sites, places to eat and arranging a taxi back to the airport at the end of our stay. We booked two rooms as we were travelling with our 2 kids ages 20 and 17 and were given rooms right next to each other. The rooms looked out over the street and with the exception of about 5 minutes during our stay there was no noise at all from the street and we were able to keep our windows open at different times to sleep. There is a small grocery across the street, great for buying bottled water for the day instead of spending 2 Euro at the local stands in the city. Location is great with Via Condoti right out the door and the Spanish Steps just a couple of minute walk. We also walked to the Forum, Vatican, etc all about 15 to 20 minutes away. We will stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: admgb
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on business. Hotel is tucked away in a court yard, but within walking distance of many of the major sights (Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Vatican City etc.). Rooms are small but clean, and the service was extremely helpful. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: az_travellr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and another couple stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July. When you arrive at the hotel, you enter through a central courtyard and can take either the stairs or elevator (fits two people) up to the hotel lobby. We were greeted at the reception desk by Khaled who checked us in and during the length of our stay he proved to be very helpful in answering our endless questions about attractions, restaurants and whatever else we felt we must ask about. His friendly disposition and great sense of humor (“Breakfast goes from 5am to 6am…”) went a long way to make us feel comfortable at the hotel and to feel like we were more than just guests. Our rooms were very clean, beds were comfortable, bathrooms had been updated with new fixtures (soap/shampoo supplied) and were spotless. Each room had a safe and a bar fridge. Unfortunately the fridge in our room didn’t keep things very cool at all so we didn’t use it much. Our room faced the courtyard below and was very quiet at night. Our traveling companions had a room facing the front street which they found to be a bit noisy in the daytime from the construction going on in the street below. The hotel was located in a safe neighborhood and we had no concerns about our safety when we were walking around at night. The hotel had good security – after 8pm and on weekends, the front entrance to the courtyard was locked. When the door was locked, there was a buzzer at the entrance to use to alert the staff at the desk and a camera for them to see who was requesting to be let in. The hotel was also in a great location to walk to many of the major attractions… 5 min to the Spanish Steps, 15 min to the Vatican, 10 min to Trevi Fountain. We also walked to the Colosseum and Forum… 20 min, I think. Shops, mostly high end, are located within 5 min. The grocery store across the street from the hotel was very handy and more affordable for buying water, soda and snacks. There is a restaurant located at the hotel as well as many others nearby. Breakfast was included with our rooms and consisted of a buffet with a variety of cereals, fruit, baked breads, quiche. There were also juices, fresh coffee and tea. Internet access was available in each room at a cost of 5 euros per 24 hours of use. This was especially useful on our last day at the hotel as we wanted to print our boarding passes for our flight home the next day. There was no printer in our room however Khaled advised us how to email the boarding pass info to the hotel’s email address where he printed them out for all four of us and had them delivered to our rooms. And we had to be at the airport very early in the next morning, so Khaled called that evening and arranged for a taxi to pick us up in the morning. In the morning the taxi was there as requested, waiting for us. We felt the hotel offers good location, clean comfortable rooms and great service…Khaled was exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: MrHughes
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a truly great location - five minutes to the Spanish Steps seconds away from Rome's best shopping street. Staff friendly, knowledgeable and helpful e.g. they reminded us about booking a taxi to the airport and by the time we walked from reception to our room our tv was on and an e-mail confirmation of the booking on the screen.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, but beware of the quad room”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisSharon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 years ago and loved the location and helpful staff. We brought our two children (ages 18 & 23) with us for this visit and wanted to book our hotel rooms for our vacation in Italy and France as suites rather than 2 full price rooms. This hotel doesn't have a suite so we asked about the quad room and the hotel did warn us that it was pretty small and they usually recommend it for couples with small children. We decided to book it anyways, figuring that we would only be in there at night. When we arrived I was so disappointed, there was no room to put suitcases, only enough room for one person to fit between the beds, the bathroom and shower were tiny and the floor was concrete. I felt as though we were in the basement of some dingy hotel. We talked to the staff and there weren't any extra rooms available that night, but they could put us in 2 double rooms the next night and for the remainder of our stay. We did have to pay for 2 full rooms, but it was worth the switch! I don't fault the hotel because they did warn us; I guess I learned that when someone in Europe says a room is small, believe them because their small is much smaller than an American's view of small. We love Kahled, he is so helpful! Our last night he recommended a restaurant that was one of the best restaurants we've eaten at in Rome. We'd go back to Hotel Fontanella Borghese.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location!!! Clean and Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Westshore
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 203 for 7 nights in September 2007. Room 203 was clean, quiet and average sized. The shower had the best water pressure I have seen in a European hotel and you could take a shower without soaking the rest of the bathroom. Hotel staff was helpful with all questions. The location was excellent. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see and only took 1 cab (except for back and forth to the airport) and that was more due to a time issue than anything else. I will say that it was very disappointing that the hotel did not offer any internet connection workstation. Breakfast consisted of coffee, juice, milk, cereal, yogurt, quiche, breads, jams, etc. No meat and the cheese was prepackaged. All things considered it was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable - not perfect; good location”
Reviews.Author: Georgia&Sunshine
Reviews.Content: Of all the places we visited in Italy we got the nicest greeting from Kaled at the front desk. He gave us a map and highlighted all the sites we could do in one day/two nights. The room was small but OK. We wanted a courtyard but got a street view. It was noisy until 1am because there is a restaurant near. We are night owls so it was OK. The room has a safe but it locks with a key that you have to keep up with or pay 30 euros fine. I prefer the types of safe where you punch in your own determined code because then no one else has a copy of the key. We didn't have hot water in the morning. I didn't think the staff was as responsive as they needed to be since we couldn't take a shower. It was fine at night but I guess it must not be able to handle everyone in the mornings. Also our toilet wouldn't always flush. The hotel did not have internet service which was very surprising and the internet cafe pointed out on the map was not close. All the other hotels in big and small towns had a computer for guests. We did have two wonderful meals, both recommended by Kaled and walking distance from hotel - La Campana (menu and waiters only speak Italian) and AL 34 - eat outside and have the 34 salad. Breakfast was good - breads, cheese, cereal, real fruit, quiche, hard boiled eggs (the only eggs we saw in Italy!). The private car called by the hotel to take us to the airport was on time (45 euros fixed price). Taxi is 40 but its not located outside the hotel so take the car. I know hotels are expensive in Rome so this is probably a reasonable deal - we paid 205 euros but I think it could at least have a computer for that price

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice people”
Reviews.Author: cuda153
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room with our 2 children. Compared with pricing in other hotels, this was a good value, although the quad room was very cramped (I think the other rooms have a little more space). The shower is amazingly small--I have decided that everyone in Rome is skinny not to fit into the stylish fashions but just to fit into the tiny showers. The complimentary breakfast was perfect for us--a great way to start each busy day. The decore is tasteful and the staff was courteous and helpful. We got a great tip on an out of the way restaurant. The location is also a big plus--you can walk to a number of different tourist spots, not just the Spanish steps. The Vatican, for example, was a relatively modest walk over the Tiber. In a city with cramped and very expensive rooms, we calculated this to be a pretty decent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Well located - our kids loved too”
Reviews.Author: KiwigirlNZ
Reviews.Content: Well appointed hotel; charming bedrooms, gorgeous sitting and dining room and delicious breakfast. Our family of four ( 2 teenagers) had 2 rooms & stayed for 5 nights and found it perfectly located. Close to all the key sites and some gorgeous eateries and shops. You look straight up the road to the Spanish Steps. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly In fact I left a pair fo brand new italian shoes in the room and on our return they couriered them to me. What superb service and attention to detail. Can't recommend highly enough. Extremely well priced. having picked it from trip advisor I was even more delighted with its standard. Since we needed 2 rooms I was much more price conscious than usual and this far exceeded my expectations. Family happy too!

Reviews.Title: “Unspoilt gem”
Reviews.Author: nedsram
Reviews.Content: You won't find this hotel - near Ponte Cavour and opposite Palazzo Borghese - on any hotel booking sites as - like its nearby sister hotel Due Torri - it's privately owned. This shows through in the exceptionally friendly welcome and immaculate presentation. The hotel (formerly known as Pensione Mistrali) has been recently renovated, including the addition of (much needed) air conditioning, but preserving the unique character of the building. Many of the rooms overlook an inner courtyard providing an island of peace amid the bustle of the Centro Storico. A plaque outside the entrance details the interesting history of the building. Here's a map of the location: /tinyurl.com/ypglkp

Reviews.Title: “Still Our Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sempre39
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Fontanella Borghese three times, first in 2002 and most recently for a week on October 2006. Although we paid the same rate in euros this stay as we did in 2002, the room was quite a bit more expensive due to the weakness of the U.S. dollar. In some compensation, we found the desk staff even more helpful than before. (We also had a lovely chat with the owner whom we'd met before.) Restaurant recommendations were outstanding. The hotel has made some alterations since our last visit. There is now a very nice sitting room and an enlarged breakfast room. We thought both changes were nice improvements. By coincidence, we were given the same room as we had on our first stay. This room overlooks the small street which runs behind the building in which the hotel is located. Unfortunately, this street is now used by evening walking tours and also includes a rather noisy restaurant, so there was quite a bit of noise until late in the evening. We will request a room facing the interior courtyard next time. And there will be a next time. We love Rome and we love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location shame about the scaffolding”
Reviews.Author: travelhogg
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the hotel for 2 nights at the end of September. Our room was quite small and the shower was not the best - in wasn't very powerful but managed to soak the floor every time you used it. It must be a well known problem as there were extra floor towels provided for this purpose I think! On the first day we arrived the window couldn't be opened due to scaffolding outside which we were told should have been gone a month ago. To be fair it was gone by the second day and we could enjoy the view of the surrounding streets. The staff were very friendly and polite. We didn't need to use them very much but I am sure if you needed something they would help you out. The streets were quite noisey at night but with the wndow closed the double glazing worked reasonably well. Cannot fault the location for sight seeing, a couple of minutes walk from the Spanish steps and easily within walking distance of all the other main sights. If you are looking for a base to explore the sights and aren't planning on spending too much time in the room then this hotel is fine. If you like a bit of luxury and space then you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: room was very small and bathroom tiny with no window. our room's only window had scaffolding outside it and had the shutters closed from outside. extremely noisy at night (from outside) and workmen woke us up early (7:30am) working on the wall of our room. Concierege could not have been nicer and had good recommendations, but lack of sleep was a drag.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I (4 adults+2 children) spent 4 nights in Rome in Oct. 05.We had a very enjoyable time. We stayed at the Hotel Fontanella Borghese; it was a lovely hotel, beautiful interiors, fabulous floors and ceilings. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfasts were good. My only complaints are; that the bathrooms are a little small especially for tall men and that the bar facility finished serving at 8.30pm, this didn't suit us as we were travelling with children and would have liked a drink after putting them to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fontanella Borghese”
Reviews.Author: lalaby
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was delightful. Our room was small, as most European hotels, but comfortable and with a nice bath. They have several nice areas to sit and relax , read or watch tv. Breakfast was average, but they always have a bowl full of chocolates ready for you. The staff is most friendly and helpful and make you feel so welcome. About a five minute walk to the Spanish Steps and closer for the famous shopping streets.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Fontanella was excellant. There are many wonderful shops and restaurants in the area. We found several local restaurants which offered good food and great prices.Kitty corner to the entrance is a small grocery store which was real convenient. Five minute walk to the Spanish Steps and aproximately twenty minutes to Castle St. Angelo. The price seems a little high especially with the Euro conversion, but it is clean, safe and the rooms are very nicely appointed. The area is also perfect for the traditional evening stroll. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto to Lovely but Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: bviwmn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay at Hotel Fontanella Borghese. Our twin-bedded room was tiny and it was impossible to take a shower without flooding the bathroom floor. In the twin-bedded rooms armoires are also very small and may not have a place to hang dresses. But the location is great, the hotel is spotless and in excellent repair, the air-conditioning works well, it was very quiet (though not very full, I think) and the staff is friendly and helpful. For the money (198 Euros per night in August) I would try somewhere else next time, but if I couldn't find a better deal, I would stay here again. I definitely would not stay here if I were not a small person! Note that the Hotel is in a portion of the second and third floors of a palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Looks wonderful but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is definitely lovely. But at $250/n not worth it -- rooms are small, and not that exciting. The location is excellent, everything is great, i just don't think i'll go back for that price ;)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Francophile94
Reviews.Content: I found the Fontanella Borghese to be a lovely place to stay. The room was not large and the shower cubicle small but the hotel and the room were extremely clean, comfortable in every respect and tastefully appointed. I did not find it noisy at all even though I was expecting a room in the middle of Rome to be so. The staff were friendly and provided very helpful advice on a range of tourist-related matters.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Fontanella Borghese
HotelInfo.Address: 84 Largo Fontanella Borghese, 00186 Rome, Italy
